li.College of Business Students: Must meet: College of Business Students: Must meet Admission

courseSection0.text:
Students seeking advising must go to Business Administration II (BA2), 101.
Open to business and non-business students. Not available to finance majors.
Minor Admission Requirements
College of Business Students: Must meet Admission
Standards for the Finance Major
Non-Business Students: Meet Prerequisites Below
Minor Requirements
None

body.text:
Complete all of the following
(Non-Business Students)
Complete the following: 
ECO2013 - Principles of Macroeconomics (3)
MAC2311C - Calculus with Analytic Geometry I (4)
MAC2312 - Calculus with Analytic Geometry II (4)
Complete at least 1 of the following: 
STA2023 - Statistical Methods I (3)
STA3032 - Probability and Statistics for Engineers (3)
Earn a "B" or better : MAC 2311C, MAC 2312, STA 2023, STA 3032

courseSection1.text6: FIN4424 - Advanced Topics in Financial Management (3)

li.A minimum GPA of 2.75 is required in all: A minimum GPA of 2.75 is required in all courses used to satisfy the minor.
li.Grades below \"C\" (2.0) or \"S\" grades: Grades below "C" (2.0) or "S" grades from other institutions are not accepted.
li.Courses taken at Florida College System: Courses taken at Florida College System institutions do not substitute for upper division courses.
li.Courses transferred must be formally eva: Courses transferred must be formally evaluated for equivalency credit. The student must provide a course syllabus and any other supporting information with his/her petition for this evaluation.
li.At least twelve hours used in the minor: At least twelve hours used in the minor must be earned at UCF within the department.
li.No credit by exam (TSD, Military credit): No credit by exam (TSD, Military credit) may be used.
li.Internship, Independent Study, or Direct: Internship, Independent Study, or Directed Research credit cannot be used toward the minor.
li.A maximum of 6 hours of the above listed: A maximum of 6 hours of the above listed required or elective courses can count toward another major or minor degree program.

courseSection2.text:
Other Requirements
A minimum GPA of 2.75 is required in all courses used to satisfy the minor.
Grades below "C" (2.0) or "S" grades from other institutions are not accepted.
Courses taken at Florida College System institutions do not substitute for upper division courses.
Courses transferred must be formally evaluated for equivalency credit. The student must provide a course syllabus and any other supporting information with his/her petition for this evaluation.
At least twelve hours used in the minor must be earned at UCF within the department.
No credit by exam (TSD, Military credit) may be used.
Internship, Independent Study, or Directed Research credit cannot be used toward the minor.
A maximum of 6 hours of the above listed required or elective courses can count toward another major or minor degree program.
